article_title: DC Circ. Won't Rehear Catholic Orgs' ACA Contraception Suits
article_text:
DC Circ. Won't Rehear Catholic Orgs' ACA Contraception Suits

Law360, Los Angeles (May 20, 2015, 9:42 PM ET) -- The D.C. Circuit on Wednesday refused to revive two suits by Catholic organizations claiming that an Affordable Care Act accommodation created for employers with religious objections to its contraception mandate was overly burdensome, although dissenting judges vehemently disagreed.



In an en banc per curiam order, the D.C. Circuit said it wouldn’t rehear the cases after a three-judge panel of the appeals court in November unanimously rejected claims by the Catholic anti-abortion organization Priests for Life and the Roman Catholic Archbishop of Washington.
